verses.text: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

similars.text: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.
Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Go thou near, and hear all that the Lord our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that the Lord our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Give ear, O Lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

verses.text: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

similars.text: Then the Lord put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.
I opened my mouth, and panted: for I longed for thy commandments.
Behold, I, the Lord, have spoken it.
And now I have spoken the words which the Lord God hath commanded me.
Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
And now I have spoken the words which the Lord God hath commanded me.
With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.
Behold, I, the Lord, have spoken it.
Then the Lord put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.

verses.text: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

similars.text: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
I will praise thee with uprightness of heart, when I shall have learned thy righteous judgments.
Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
My tongue shall speak of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteousness.

verses.text: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

similars.text: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath made me free from the law of sin and death.
Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

And I, the Lord God, formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul, the first flesh upon the earth, the first man also; nevertheless, all things were before created; but spiritually were they created and made according to my word.
All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
Thus saith the Lord God unto these bones; Behold, I will cause breath to enter into you, and ye shall live:
And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

verses.text: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

similars.text: Order my steps in thy word: and let not any iniquity have dominion over me.

verses.text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

similars.text: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

verses.text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

similars.text: Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, and lest they should say, Our hand is high, and the Lord hath not done all this.
My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy judgments.
Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the Lord your God.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.
Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
Stablish thy word unto thy servant, who is devoted to thy fear.

Therefore fear thou not, O my servant Jacob, saith the Lord; neither be dismayed, O Israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar, and thy seed from the land of their captivity; and Jacob shall return, and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.
Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
And shall say unto them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day unto battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;
Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

verses.text: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

similars.text: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
Verily, verily, I say unto you who now hear my words, which are my voice, blessed are ye inasmuch as you receive these things;
And he said: Yea, I believe all the words which thou hast spoken.

And the Lord heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me; and the Lord said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have spoken.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
Thou art my portion, O Lord: I have said that I would keep thy words.
Behold, I, the Lord, have spoken it.
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

And now, my brethren, I would that ye should hear me, for I speak in the energy of my soul; for behold, I have spoken unto you plainly that ye cannot err, or have spoken according to the commandments of God.

What I the Lord have spoken, I have spoken, and I excuse not myself; and though the heavens and the earth pass away, my word shall not pass away, but shall all be fulfilled, whether by mine own voice or by the voice of my servants, it is the same.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.
Come ye near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; from the time that it was, there am I: and now the Lord God, and his Spirit, hath sent me.
I tell thee these things as a witness unto thee--that the words or the work which thou hast been writing are true.
And now I have spoken the words which the Lord God hath commanded me.
And the Lord said unto me, They have well spoken that which they have spoken.
For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.

Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been cast out and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst visit them in thine anger with speedy destruction.
For they of whom I speak are they who have not as yet heard my voice; neither have I at any time manifested myself unto them.
And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I said it, that they may believe that thou hast sent me.
Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
Have ye not seen a vain vision, and have ye not spoken a lying divination, whereas ye say, The Lord saith it; albeit I have not spoken?
I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.

And thou didst hear me because of mine afflictions and my sincerity; and it is because of thy Son that thou hast been thus merciful unto me, therefore I will cry unto thee in all mine afflictions, for in thee is my joy; for thou hast turned thy judgments away from me, because of thy Son.
Come ye near unto me; I have not spoken in secret; from the beginning, from the time that it was declared have I spoken; and the Lord God, and his Spirit, hath sent me.
Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

Verily, verily, I say unto thee, blessed art thou for what thou hast done; for thou hast inquired of me, and behold, as often as thou hast inquired thou hast received instruction of my Spirit. If it had not been so, thou wouldst not have come to the place where thou art at this time.
Behold, blessed are you for this thing, and for speaking my words which I have given you according to my commandments.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
Behold, thou knowest that thou hast inquired of me and I did enlighten thy mind; and now I tell thee these things that thou mayest know that thou hast been enlightened by the Spirit of truth;
And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed; because thou hast obeyed my voice.
If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the Lord, we will not hearken unto thee.
I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.
Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy judgment.
And because thou hast inquired of me concerning the transgressor, thou art blessed.
And as thou hast said in a revelation, given to us, calling us thy friends, saying--Call your solemn assembly, as I have commanded you;

And then shall ye know that I have seen Jesus, and that he hath talked with me face to face, and that he told me in plain humility, even as a man telleth another in mine own language, concerning these things;

Hearken, O ye Gentiles, and hear the words of Jesus Christ, the Son of the living God, which he hath commanded me that I should speak concerning you, for, behold he commandeth me that I should write, saying:
Give heed to me, O Lord, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.

And these are the words which he spake and caused to be written, saying: My brethren, all ye that have assembled yourselves together, you that can hear my words which I shall speak unto you this day; for I have not commanded you to come up hither to trifle with the words which I shall speak, but that you should hearken unto me, and open your ears that ye may hear, and your hearts that ye may understand, and your minds that the mysteries of God may be unfolded to your view.
I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.

And the Lord said unto him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication, that thou hast made before me: I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
Behold, blessed are you for this thing, and for speaking my words which I have given unto you according to my commandments.
And the Lord heard the voice of your words, and was wroth, and sware, saying,
Wherefore, you can testify that you have heard my voice, and know my words.

And the Lord heard the voice of your words, when ye spake unto me; and the Lord said unto me, I have heard the voice of the words of this people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all that they have spoken.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them.
But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
And the Lord said unto me, They have well spoken that which they have spoken.
Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

verses.text: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

similars.text: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
Mine eye also shall see my desire on mine enemies, and mine ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
And the Lord is near, and he justifieth me. Who will contend with me? Let us stand together. Who is mine adversary? Let him come near me, and I will smite him with the strength of my mouth.
For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.
Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Because ye have spoken vanity, and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, saith the Lord God.
But behold I say unto you, love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them who despitefully use you and persecute you;
He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not with me scattereth.
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.
My times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy unto thine enemies, and an adversary unto thine adversaries.
Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.
By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
And whomsoever ye curse, I will curse, and ye shall avenge me of mine enemies.
Thou through thy commandments hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.
Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?
Behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the Lord God of hosts: for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, I, even I, am against thee, and will execute judgments in the midst of thee in the sight of the nations.
Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.

Yea, and thou hast also heard me when I have been cast out and have been despised by mine enemies; yea, thou didst hear my cries, and wast angry with mine enemies, and thou didst visit them in thine anger with speedy destruction.
He hath confounded mine enemies, unto the causing of them to quake before me.
Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.
Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,

Behold, here I am: witness against me before the Lord, and before his anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind mine eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.
Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
Behold they shall, for I have decreed it, begin to prevail against mine enemies from this very hour.
Therefore saith the Lord, the Lord of hosts, the mighty One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge me of mine enemies:
But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;
Behold, I am against thee, O inhabitant of the valley, and rock of the plain, saith the Lord; which say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?
Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.
Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.
The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
Being driven and smitten by the hands of mine enemies, on whom I will pour out my wrath without measure in mine own time.
The Lord shall cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and flee before thee seven ways.
For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.
And again: I will set a mark upon him that fighteth against thee and thy seed.
Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

And inasmuch as mine enemies come against you to drive you from my goodly land, which I have consecrated to be the land of Zion, even from your own lands after these testimonies, which ye have brought before me against them, ye shall curse them;
He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.
He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

verses.text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

similars.text: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.
Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

verses.text: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

similars.text: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?
For thou, Lord, art high above all the earth: thou art exalted far above all gods.

verses.text: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

similars.text: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.
And the voice spake unto him again the second time, What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.

Now, whether there shall be one time, or a second time, or a third time, that men shall come forth from the dead, it mattereth not; for God knoweth all these things; and it sufficeth me to know that this is the case--that there is a time appointed that all shall rise from the dead.

verses.text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

similars.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,

verses.text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

similars.text: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
And he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,
And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.
And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
Incline thine ear, O Lord, and hear; open thine eyes, O Lord, and see: and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent to reproach the living God.

verses.text: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

similars.text: A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

verses.text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

similars.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

verses.text: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

similars.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.

verses.text: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

similars.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
Out of Asher his bread shall be fat, and he shall yield royal dainties.
Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

verses.text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

similars.text: In the body of his flesh through death, to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:

verses.text: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

similars.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
Behold, here is the man, we deliver him into thy hands; thou mayest do with him as seemeth thee good.

verses.text: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:
He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

similars.text: He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
The Lord make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
The righteous shall be glad in the Lord, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
The Lord is well pleased for his righteousness' sake; he will magnify the law, and make it honourable.
My meditation of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the Lord.
The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

For the Lord hath heard thy prayers, and hath judged of thy righteousness, and hath sent me to declare unto thee that thou mayest rejoice; and that thou mayest declare unto thy people, that they may also be filled with joy.
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

Behold, I say unto him, he exalts himself and does not humble himself sufficiently before me; but if he will bow down before me, and humble himself in mighty prayer and faith, in the sincerity of his heart, then will I grant unto him a view of the things which he desires to see.
As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
For the Lord taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.
And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: this hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the Lord of hosts.

But let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.
The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation.
He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

And for his love he shall be great, for he shall be mine if he do this, saith the Lord. I have seen the work which he hath done, which I accept if he continue, and will crown him with blessings and great glory.
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
Behold, that thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
And they shall see his face; and his name shall be in their foreheads.
When thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord, will I seek.
He shall receive the blessing from the Lord, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
And so it is on the other hand. If he hath repented of his sins, and desired righteousness until the end of his days, even so he shall be rewarded unto righteousness.

verses.text: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

similars.text: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:

verses.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

similars.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for I will bring upon it, even upon Moab, the year of their visitation, saith the Lord.
To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

verses.text: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

similars.text: For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of God.

verses.text: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

similars.text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

verses.text: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

similars.text: Verily I say unto you, even now, if he will hearken unto my voice, it shall be well with him. Even so. Amen.
If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever will not hearken unto my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
I will hear what God the Lord will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

verses.text: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

similars.text: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken is good for us to do.
Put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declare thou, that thou mayest be justified.
For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.
Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

verses.text: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

similars.text: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
Learn of me, and listen to my words; walk in the meekness of my Spirit, and you shall have peace in me.
Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
And it is expedient that thou shouldst hold thy peace concerning them, and not teach them until ye have received them in full.
But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoar head go down to the grave in peace.
Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.
Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
And now, verily I say unto you, and this is wisdom, make unto yourselves friends with the mammon of unrighteousness, and they will not destroy you.

For behold, thus saith the Lord God: I will give unto the children of men line upon line, precept upon precept, here a little and there a little; and blessed are those who hearken unto my precepts, and lend an ear unto my counsel, for they shall learn wisdom; for unto him that receiveth I will give more; and from them that shall say, We have enough, from them shall be taken away even that which they have.
And if ye will not for all this hearken unto me, but walk contrary unto me;

But as you cannot always judge the righteous, or as you cannot always tell the wicked from the righteous, therefore I say unto you, hold your peace until I shall see fit to make all things known unto the world concerning the matter.
So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud: for the Lord hath spoken.
Therefore, follow me, and listen to the counsel which I shall give unto you.
And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
I will hear what God the Lord will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
But if ye will not hearken unto me, and will not do all these commandments;
Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
Keep my commandments; hold your peace; appeal unto my Spirit;
But to be learned is good if they hearken unto the counsels of God.
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee; and let thy judgments help me.
For I give unto them a commandment; wherefore hearken and hear, for thus saith the Lord unto them--
He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
And the spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;
And the Spirit of the Lord shall rest upon him, the spirit of wisdom and understanding, the spirit of counsel and might, the spirit of knowledge and of the fear of the Lord;
Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Lord: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.
O hearken, ye elders of my church, and give ear to the words which I shall speak unto you.
If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
